documents.document: Perseverance is not a long race; it is many races one after another. -Walter Elliot
The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity. -Ellen Parr

Forget everything you thought was true about remembering. https://t.co/mrW2U4ns0u

Ideas can be life-changing. Sometimes all you need to open the door is just one more good idea.… https://t.co/MMnoDf7n1I
Competition Quotes https://t.co/0goIbO1MIY
Don’t worry about failure. Worry about the chances you miss when you don’t even try. -Unknown
Greatness Quotes https://t.co/5eK77ZI4jU
Your diamonds are not in far distant mountains or in yonder seas; they are in your own backyard, if you but dig for them. -Russel Conwell
If we do not plant knowledge when young, it will give us no shade when we are old. -Lord Chesterfield
Of what does not concern you, say nothing good or bad. -Italian Proverb
You will never change your life until you change something you do daily. -Mike Murdock
Since you are like no other being ever created since the beginning of time, you are incomparable. -Brenda Ueland
"It's never crowded along the extra mile." -Dr Wayne Dyer
I have lived my life according to this principle: If I'm afraid of it, then I must do it. -Erica Jong
Failure after long perseverance is much grander than never to have a striving good enough to be called a failure. -George Eliot
Perseverance is failing nineteen times and succeeding the twentieth. -Julie Andrews
Content makes poor men rich; discontent makes rich men poor. -Benjamin Franklin
Spectacular achievements are always preceded by unspectacular preparation. -Roger Staubach
Practice, practice, practice until you eventually get numb on rejections. -Brian Klemmer
Improvement of one's economic position is helped more by cool persistence than by hot enthusiasm. -William Feather
It is because they took the easy way out that rivers, and people, go crooked. -Jill Peterson
Other people's interruptions of your work are relatively insignificant compared with the countless times you interrupt yourself. -B Francis
"Small opportunities are often the beginning of great enterprises." -Demosthenes
Determination is the wake-up call to the human will. -Anthony Robbins
To the world you may be one person, but to one person you may be the world. -Paulette Mitchell
With ordinary talents and extraordinary perseverance, all things are attainable. -Sir Thomas Fowell Buxton
I always prefer to believe the best of everybody -- it saves so much trouble. - Rudyard Kipling
Formal education will make you a living; self-education will make you a fortune. -Jim Rohn
@AntZ56 I haven't decided yet. Ask me again in a few days. lol
Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal. -Hannah More
Visualize this thing that you want, see it, feel it, believe in it. Make your mental blue print, and begin to build. -R Collier
"Good things happen to those who hustle." -Anais Nin
Human beings, by changing the inner attitudes of their minds, can change the outer aspects of their lives. -William James
Defeat in doing right is nevertheless victory. -Frederick W. Robertson
Life brings simple pleasures to us every day. It is up to us to make them wonderful memories. -Cathy Allen
The closer one gets to the top, the more one finds there is no "top." -Nancy Barcus
Don't let your sorrow come higher than your knees. -Swedish Proverb
Failure is a detour, not a dead-end street. -Zig Ziglar
Courtesies of a small and trivial character are the ones which strike deepest in the grateful and appreciating heart. -Henry Clay
When thought becomes excessively painful, action is the finest remedy. -Salman Rushdie
Learn all you can from the mistakes of others. You won't have time to make them all yourself. -Alfred Sheinwold
Begin somewhere; you cannot build a reputation on what you intend to do. -Liz Smith
The sky is the daily bread of the eyes. -Ralph Waldo Emerson
NOW - Poem https://t.co/67ou9Z6YOQ
A winner makes commitments. A loser makes promises. -Unknown
Poster on the wall at the #facebook office in Toronto. Note the byline at the bottom. https://t.co/mo1rPep0b6
Human beings hardly ever learn from the experience of others. They learn, and not often, on their own, the hard way. -Heinlein
Difficulties increase the nearer we approach the goal. -Goethe
Hope sees the invisible, feels the intangible, and achieves the impossible. -Charles Caleb Colton
If u would not be forgotten as soon as you are dead, either write things worth reading or do things worth writing. -Ben Franklin
It's good to do uncomfortable things. It's weight training for life. ~ Anne Lamott
The gent who wakes up and finds himself a success hasn't been asleep. -Wilson Mizner
A word of encouragement during a failure is worth more than an hour of praise after success. -Unknown
Motivation alone is not enough. If you have an idiot and you motivate him, now you have a motivated idiot. -Jim Rohn
Listening Quotes https://t.co/IMv5oSIMVS
"I can live for two months on a good compliment." -Mark Twain
The greatest test of courage on earth is to bear defeat without losing heart. -Robert Green Ingersoll
There is nothing in the world so much admired as a man who knows how to bear unhappiness with courage. -Seneca the Younger
Victorious warriors win first and then go to war, while defeated warriors go to war first and then seek to win. -Sun Tzu
Every man is a damn fool for at least five minutes every day; wisdom consists in not exceeding the limit. -Elbert Hubbard
What you intuitively desire, that is possible to you. -D.H. Lawrence
Happiness is to be found along the way, not at the end of the road, for then the journey is over and it is too late. -R Updegraff
The past does not equal the future. -Anthony Robbins
It's easy to say "no!" when there's a deeper "yes!" burning inside. -Stephen R. Covey
Norman Vincent Peale Quotes https://t.co/JQhfiQNreB
The difference between the impossible and the possible lies in a person's determination. -Tommy Lasorda
Let a fool hold his tongue and he will pass for a sage. -Publilius Syrus
If you put off everything till you're sure of it, you'll never get anything done. - Norman Vincent Peale
"The man who does not read good books has no advantage over the man who cannot read them." - Mark Twain
A slander is like a hornet; if you cannot kill it dead the first blow, better not strike at it. -Josh Billings
The leaders of mankind are those who lift their feet from the dusty road & lift their eyes to the illumined future. -W. Wilson
Do each daily task the best we can; act as though the eye of opportunity were always upon us. -William Feather
UPDATE #4: @facebook closed my 2nd ticket w/ the same generic reply: ask the thief nicely to return my stolen page. Re-opened ticket.
Those who lack the courage will always find a philosophy to justify it. - Albert Camus
The superior man acts before he speaks, and afterwards speaks according to his action. -Confucius
Difficulties Quotes https://t.co/AlxaRTMrVF
We all have the extraordinary coded within us...waiting to be released. -Jean Houston
Talking much is a sign of vanity, for the one who is lavish with words is cheap in deeds. -Sir Walter Raleigh
UPDATE #3: Reached out to many @facebook employees asking to help get my stolen Page back. One has taken interest & given us SOME hope.
Cause change and lead; accept change and survive; resist change and die. -Ray Norda
Words may show a man's wit but actions his meaning. -Benjamin Franklin
"You may have to fight a battle more than once to win it." -Margaret Thatcher
People might not get all they work for in this world, but they must certainly work for all they get. -Frederick Douglass
Update #2: @facebook said can't give page back b/c they can't prove it was mine. Suggested I ask thief nicely to give it back. Re-opened.
I feel an earnest and humble desire, and shall till I die, to increase the stock of harmless cheerfulness. -Charles Dickens
An inventor fails 999 times and if he succeeds once, he's victorious. He treats his failures as practice shots. -Charles Kettering
Update #1: Still no resolution on my stolen FB page. Still waiting for @facebook to even look at my trouble ticket from Friday.
